thread.title: Could this be the next great Western film?
thread.title_full: Could this be the next great Western film? - Telegraph

author: Oliver Pritchett
title: Could this be the next great Western film?
text: I try to read the small print on food packets, but my mind always wanders to thoughts of the screenplay I’m writing. It’s a Western about a widower named Chuck Protein who has a ranch in Salt County, Wyoming , with 500 head of pedigree gluten cattle. Chuck likes to narrow his blue eyes and gaze across his lush grassland at the distant mountain range known as the Saturates. The next ranch is owned by his bitter enemy Ed Lactose. They fell out many years ago over Wheatflour, a beautiful young woman with flowing blonde hair. She died tragically young. Now Chuck runs his ranch with his son Cal, his old dog Fibre and his memories. It’s complicated because Cal is in love with Ed Lactose’s flighty and wilful daughter Whey. Both the fathers strongly disapprove. Whey is poured into tubs to make cheese (Andrew Crowley) When Cal gets on his horse Stabiliser and rides into the nearby town of Nutrition he gets in a fight in the Energy Bar Saloon with Whey’s brother, Allergen Lactose. Cal gets badly beaten up. “Stay away from Whey ,” Allergen shouts after him as he rides off into the night. Chuck Protein is furious when he hears what has happened and immediately sets off for the Lactoses’ Per Portion ranch. As the two men square up for a fight, Charlie Citric, the Nutrition town drunk, arrives wheezing with the bad news: “The Additive boys are in town.” The Additives are notorious brawlers, bank robbers and rustlers and Protein and Lactose know they will soon be coming to the ranch. The two old enemies will be forced to team up. They hear the hoofbeat of approaching horses and they crouch behind the water trough. Chuck Protein draws his emulsifier from its holster and gets ready to fire... telegraph.co.uk Follow @telegoodlife
